info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 21 at 9:26PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...LIGHT SNOW CAUSING SLICK ROADS ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS... A large area of light snow moving across northeast Georgia, Upstate South Carolina, and the western Piedmont and foothills of North Carolina will result in a light accumulation of snow, generally between a dusting and up to one inch. In spite of the small amount of snow, temperatures are cold enough for the snow to stick to the roads in many locations. This is expected to make roads slippery in spots, especially bridges and overpasses, and places where the roads have not been treated. Use caution while driving around the region where snow is falling and covering the roads. Slow down and allow plenty of distance between cars. Patches of black ice will persist across the region through the overnight hours where snow has fallen. Temperatures will continue to fall through the 20s through early Saturday.
